title: How to Rearrange Your War Base in Clash of Clans

steps.title: Go to the Layout Editor.
steps.content: Go to the Layout Editor. During gameplay, select the button with a hand icon you see on the right-hand side of the screen to enter the Layout Editor. The Layout Editor allows you to rearrange your camp based on your preference.

steps.title: Go to the War Base Editor.
steps.content: Go to the War Base Editor. Inside the Layout Editor, select the “War Base” tab from the menu and pick the war base layout you want to edit. Once you’ve made your choice, select the “Edit Layout” button to begin.

steps.title: Rearrange your war base.
steps.content: Rearrange your war base. Select the structure you want to move and drag it to the location where you want to place it. Drop the structure on its new location to place it there. You can move any building anywhere within the boundaries of your war base.

steps.title: Remove a structure.
steps.content: Remove a structure. If you want to temporarily remove a structure from the map, select the “Erase Mode” button on the lower right corner of the game screen and switch it to “On.” Once Erase Mode has been enabled, select the structure you want to remove, and it will be temporarily placed on the item slots at the bottom of the game screen. To bring back the structure you removed, simply select it from the item slot and drag it back to where you want to put it on the map.

steps.title: Remove all items.
steps.content: Remove all items. If you want to temporarily remove every structure from the map all at once, just select “Remove All” from the lower right corner of the screen, just above the “Erase Mode” button. This will put all structures on the map into the item slots at the bottom of the screen. Remember though that you have to put all these structures back on your map one by one after you’ve removed them all.

steps.title: Save your changes and exit.
steps.content: Save your changes and exit. Once you’re done, tap the “Save Village” button on the lower left corner of the screen to save the rearrangements you made on to your Clash of Clans account. Afterwards, select the “Exit” button to go back to the Layout Editor menu. Note that you cannot save your changes unless you’ve put all the structures from the item slot back on the map.

steps.title: Set the rearranged layout as your default base.
steps.content: Set the rearranged layout as your default base. If the war base you edited isn’t the one you’re using, select the “Set as Active” button on the Layout Editor Menu button to use it as your current war base layout.

steps.title: Go to the Layout Editor.
steps.content: Go to the Layout Editor. During gameplay, select the button with a hand icon you see on the right-hand side of the screen to enter the Layout Editor. The Layout Editor allows you to rearrange your camp based on your preference.

steps.title: Copy a war base editor.
steps.content: Copy a war base editor. Inside the Layout Editor, select the “War Base” tab from the menu and pick the war base layout you want to copy. Once you’ve made your choice, select the “Copy Layout” button to duplicate the selected war base.

steps.title: Duplicate the war base.
steps.content: Duplicate the war base. There are three slots that you can use to save your war base layout. Pick one of the slots you see on the Layout Editor and press the “Okay” button on the confirmation pop-up to instantly duplicate the selected war base. All the changes will be automatically saved once you’ve selected a slot.

steps.title: Set the duplicated layout as your default base.
steps.content: Set the duplicated layout as your default base. If you want to use the duplicated war base as your default, select the “Set as Active” button on the Layout Editor Menu button to use it as your current war base layout.
